review.title: Skill Analysis with Time Series Image Data
review.abstract: We present a skill analysis with time series image data using data mining methods, focused on table tennis. We do not use body model, but use only hi-speed movies, from which time series data are obtained and analyzed using data mining methods such as C4.5 and so on. We identify internal models for technical skills as evaluation skillfulness for the forehand stroke of table tennis, and discuss mono and meta-functional skills for improving skills.

metadata.title: Skill Analysis with Time Series Image Data

sections.text: We do not use a body model, but only high-speed films, from which time series data is extracted and analyzed using data mining methods such as C4.5 and so on. We identify internal models of technical skills as evaluation skill for the presence of table tennis and discuss mono and meta-functional skills to improve skills. Keywords - Component; Time Series Data, Sport Skill, DataMining, Image Processing, Knowledge AcquisitionI. INTRODUCTIONAs for human action and skill, internal structure of technical skills is layered with mono-functional skills generated by human intention, and meta-functional skills adapted with environmental variations. [T.Shiose.2004], [Y.Matsumoto et al., in addition, we discuss that highly qualified workers in companies have internal models of layered skills.

sections.heading: STROKES
sections.text: In the research of motion analysis, [H.Oka.1991] records active tension of the muscle fiber with the help of expert needles on the table, and [J.Moribe.1991] uses a marking observation method with multiple markings on the body, where their objects illustrate the body structure and the skeletal structure of the body. Figure 1 shows our system structures, the technical skills consist of internal models of layered structures such as: mono-functional skills associated with each body part, and meta-functional skills as upper layer. We therefore identify the internal models of the observed time series image evaluation with represented actions, without discussing the discussion of the body structure or skeletal structure. In this paper we focus on table tennis among different sports, and analyze the skills of proceeding from observed time series image datasets and qualification evaluations with represented activities.
